intro: Helianthemum umbellatum var. rubriflorum, commonly known as the red-flowered rock rose, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm, with dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of red, pink, and white, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its compact size and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, thriving in Mediterranean climates.
